feed.title: Category: picks | User group for Viennese rubyists

entry.title: Picks / what the vienna.rb team thinks is worth sharing this week
entry.content:
25/06 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks – or: what we think is worth sharing – every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the sixtieth edition:

Laura:
  • Introducing Lotus – A complete web framework for Ruby
  • PGExercises – Cause you can never get enough Postgres
  • World Cup Results for Hackers – sorry.. the football fever has struck.
Guest picks by Floor:
  • 2048 – in Haskell. Really.
  • Pixi Paint – <3 pixel art.

entry.title: Picks / what the vienna.rb team thinks is worth sharing this week
entry.content:
18/06 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks – or: what we think is worth sharing – every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the fifty-ninth edition:

Laura:
  • Ngrok – Easily expose a local web server to the internet
  • Locking conversations on GitHub – Make the conversation on an issue or pull request collaborator-only.
Guest picks by Floor:
  • Floor – of course I need to mention this ‘simple and lightweight foundation for web applications written in Rust’.
  • Learn Rust – … now WITH live editor and everything.
  • octicons – GitHub open sourced their icon font. Move over font awesome!

entry.title: Picks / what the vienna.rb team thinks is worth sharing this week
entry.content:
04/06 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks – or: what we think is worth sharing – every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the fifty-seventh edition:

Laura:
  • Markdown Cheatsheet – An intuitive Markdown Cheatsheet
  • Inch – A command-line tool that helps you improve your project’s documentation
  • All the little things – Sandi Metz' talk from RailsConf 2014
Alex:
  • Random (and probably useless) Rubyisms – Miguel Palhas about some not-so-well-known ruby features.
  • Octotree – Nice little Chrome extension that let’s you display GitHub code in tree format.
Tony:
  • 10 most common rails mistakes – 10 Most Common Mistakes that Rails Programmers Make
  • End-to-end Encryption in GMail/Chrome – Making end-to-end encryption easier to use
  • Stackoverflow done right? – A simple pattern for every Stackoverflow thread (bwahaha)

entry.title: Picks / what the vienna.rb team thinks is worth sharing this week
entry.content:
21/05 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks – or: what we think is worth sharing – every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the fifty-sixth edition:

Laura:
  • Regular Expressions Without Fear – A list of great resources put together by Beverly Nelson
  • Local TLD – maintain a local development top level domain
  • Contrast Ratio Tool – Lea Verou’s Contrast/Ratio Tool
Alex:
  • PostgreSQL – PostgreSQL 9.4 Beta 1 Released
  • test against certain time – NEW Rails 4.1 travel_to test helper
  • admin_view – Rails 4 generator of CRUD admin interfaces for existing models.

entry.title: Picks / what the vienna.rb team thinks is worth sharing this week
entry.content:
14/05 Picks!

In a series on this website we’ll entertain YOU with our picks – or: what we think is worth sharing – every week. Books, articles, gems, fun stuff… you’re in for an eclectic mix! So, here’s for the fifty-fifth edition:

Laura:
  • Euruject – For anyone who has ever felt rejected by Eurucamp ;)
  • Highlight – Code highlighting for Keynote presentations
  • Date/Time format cheatsheet – Get that date and time formatting syntax right, once and for all.
Alex:
  • Is TDD dead – Discussing about TDD with DHH, Kent Beck, and Martin Fowler.
  • Product Roadmap – How to define a Product Roadmap.
  • Ahoy – Simple, powerful analytics for Rails
